stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Jessica
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 7 Years
[Place of Birth] Victoria
[Date of Birth] Mar 3
[Race] Feline
[Height] 149cm
[Infection Status]
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Excellent
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Excellent
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Jessica Brynley, after departing from Blacksteel HQ for personal reasons, chose to go to the frontier to become a sheriff. Currently, she provides assistance to Rhodes Island as a partnered operator in the local branch office.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Jessica shows no signs of Originium infection.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.19 u/L
Jessica's BOCD has increased from before, but is still in the safe range. However, she has been out on the frontier for quite some time, and is often exposed to Originium products without proper protective measures, so we need to pay close attention to her.

'I'm actually more worried about her old injuries than about her getting infected.'
––Medical Operator from the Frontier Branch Office

We don't know precisely why Jessica set aside her mercenary career, and Blacksteel isn't particularly forthcoming about it. Whenever we bring it up, the person in charge always seems say something evasive before quickly changing the subject. However, it is true that Jessica has long been dissatisfied with Blacksteel's tough, uncompromising way of doing things, which the operators familiar with her had all noticed to some extent. On several occasions she has returned to Rhodes Island from a Blacksteel mission without outwardly displaying any negative emotions, but would instead lock herself in her room and not communicate with anyone for days at a time.
Afterwards, when we found out that she had been disciplined for disobeying her superiors, we realized that her differences with the PMC would be difficult to reconcile. This clash came to a head during a mission in the forested belt of Eastern Columbia, resulting in Jessica walking away from Blacksteel and her career, turning her back on both Fort Barron and the Brynley family to start over in a brand new land.
Fortunately, our partnership with her does not end simply because she severed ties with Blacksteel. The burdenbeast station she established on the frontier works together with our branch office to deliver medicine to remote areas that cannot otherwise be reached by vehicle, ensuring that sick pioneers can still get medication in a timely manner, while Jessica also needed funding to establish a frontier camp.
We are extremely pleased to be working together with her once again. While she may appear soft and shy on the surface, deep down she is actually tough and resilient. She also has a lot of empathy and is keenly aware of the emotions of others. These rare qualities allow her to comfort those who've suffered from various traumas, but also make her more susceptible to their emotions. It often takes her a long time to escape from that pain and sadness. Even more unfortunate is the fact that she stubbornly chooses to face everything alone. Despite everything she's witnessed and endured as a mercenary, Jessica has always been reluctant to share her experiences—not that it's our place to pry. But just by closely observing her behavior, we do believe that she's doing much better now.
At least, she now rarely isolates herself in the shooting range after returning to the landship from the frontier.

'Before officially participating in Blacksteel's field missions, Jessica had been working as a weapons tester in the Equipment and Applied Technology Department. There, she was exposed to a wide array of cutting-edge weaponry, and got to know many veterans retired from the Armed Personnel Dispatch Department. They were all experienced and could provide constructive advice during the weapons development process, and it's clear that Jessica has been heavily influenced by them, on top of her other experiences. Not only is she accustomed to using various weapons, but she's also proficient at modifying and improving them.'
'Uh huh.'
'In terms of weapon selection, Jessica prefers to carry a Blacksteel Model 1094 pneumatic handgun, a high-performance weapon representing the pinnacle of Blacksteel's sophisticated weapons R&D. As soon as it launched, it became the most popular gun of the year, beloved by mercenaries. But when faced with more complex situations, she will turn to a self-modified assault rifle, which is extremely accurate, powerful, and easy to assemble and disassemble quickly.'
'Uh huh.'
'Aside from those two commonly-used firearms, the presence of ships and armored vehicles in some extreme combat environments can pose serious difficulties. That's when she turns to a Raythean heavy-duty anti-armor/anti-ship cannon. And the accompanying tactical shield also takes mobility into account and can be used as a gun mount in addition to its basic protective function. Plus, the space inside the shield can be used to store additional small arms, ammunition, and other military equipment.'
'Uh huh.'
'But as you know, the battlefield is constantly shifting and requires thorough preparation each and every time, so Jessica tends to bring her entire arsenal with her, which greatly tests her load-bearing capabilities and arm strength. Now that she's out on the frontier, where the outdoor combat can be harsh and fierce bandits show up in convoys to rob supplies, she needs to carry not only her gear, but also extra supplies and—'
'Uh huh... So you're saying that's why you lost to her in 47 arm-wrestling contests in a row, even though you claim you can bench press 200 kilos. Gotcha.'
'......'
'Uh huh...?'
'Graaah––!'
––Excerpts from an everyday conversation between HR Operators

'Bernie Brynley and his wife already had a son and two daughters when they went on to have a third daughter in Jessica. As the family's youngest, everyone doted on her; not only were her parents extremely loving, but her brother and sisters were very close to her as well. There are reports that several of her promotions at Blacksteel were due to her family's support.
'While we don't know what sort of crime Jessica Brynley committed to get sent out to the frontier, it makes sense for a pampered rich girl who never learned right from wrong to be capable of just about anything. Yesterday, when confronted by doubtful reporters, Bernie Brynley still tried to defend his daughter, throwing his dignity to the wayside and screaming at them.'
'Bank robbery?! Where the hell did you hear that nonsense? Utterly ridiculous. Are you implying that there's a bank robber in MY family?'
'You'd best watch your mouth, sir. That's my daughter you're trying to slander!'
––Excerpts from the morning news of a Columbian TV station

'Their coverage of me was so one-sided.'
Turning off the TV, the girl looked back and addressed the operator behind her.
'Yeah, I agree. You're not like that at all, Jessica. Everyone here knows that.'
'No, that's not what I meant. They didn't even mention my grandfather, even though he was the one closest to me.'
'Huh? THAT'S what's bothering you?'
'Yeah. When he was with me, he didn't act like an elder at all, more like a playmate. When I was little, my favorite thing to do was sit in his arms and listen to him brag about his adventures out on the frontier, back when he was a soldier.
'Whenever he was done, he'd find his tie smeared with puree and cream. But that's just how it was. I was really little at the time. I was always eating, and would also crawl around all over the place... He really was the best grandfather ever.'
'What happened afterward?'
'Well... I grew up, and went off to secondary school in Victoria. Then he suddenly fell ill, and by the time I made it back home, he had already passed. I only had time to lay a bouquet of flowers in front of his tombstone.'
'I... I'm so sorry...'
'Don't apologize, I'm the one who brought it up. I'd never blame you for that.
'It's just nice having someone I can talk to about him...'
––Excerpts from a conversation between two operators while watching the morning news.

Everyone was shocked when they met Jessica out on the frontier. The girl in front of them was wearing coarse trousers and a plaid shirt, and behind her followed a neighing herd of burdenbeasts. She was riding barefoot on the lead beast, her skin flushed by the sun. If not for that familiar gun at her waist, nobody would've recognized that she was the same operator who used to work with us aboard the landship. After learning that we'd pass through the camp she was living in on our way to our destination, she offered to give us a ride. Quite fortunate for us, actually, since we were worried about damaging our vehicle at the time.
Atop the burdenbeasts, we headed up the river into a woodland. There, we discovered what life was like for her after leaving Blacksteel: in the middle of the night, several insects got through the tent's damage fabric. Be it the noisy buzzing of their wings or the itchy bumps from their bites, everyone was so fed up that they were swatting them one-by-one. But Jessica didn't seem to mind at all. She was simply curled up in a makeshift cot of two chairs pushed together, sleeping soundly. When an insect landed on her eyelid and left a huge bump behind, she simply rubbed it unconsciously before falling back into a deep slumber.
This one night was but a sliver of Jessica's hard-knock life. Not only did she need to deal with complex issues around the camp on a daily basis, she also had to deal with bandits and beasts periodically coming to harass her. Fortunately, she doesn't have to endure these things alone, as there are many people supporting her: the Elafia cook responsible for the camp's meals has exceptional skills, and even the most unpalatable ingredients are delicious in her hands; the old man tending the campfire has dexterous hands, and repaired our vehicle for us; there is also a girl there who is good with numbers, and is in charge of all the camp's finances; in addition, there's a Sankta hunter who's as good at herding livestock as he is ill-mannered, and he and Jessica take turns ensuring the security of the camp. Through everyone's mutual support, the newly-established camp quickly got on track and invited other pioneers to join.
Before we left, Jessica pointed to a forest in the distance and said this:
'We plan to buy a nice pine forest. On the frontier, logging is a relative secure industry, and good-quality white pine can be sold in a nomadic city for two hundred certs per cubic yard. That'll give us enough funds to build a small logging plate. Once we have a nomadic plate, everyone's lives will be that much better.'
As she spoke, her eyes let out a soft shine before becoming placid and calm again. During this whole exchange, her gaze remained fixed on that forest, not wavering for a moment.

'That's correct, Doctor. I participated in an armed robbery on the Davistown bank. That's just a fact, and I have nothing to dispute.'
The girl looks at you and rubs her hands together anxiously.
'However, I'm not on the frontier to serve out a sentence. I wasn't charged with any crime.
'Not because I was motivated by wanting to help the locals being extorted by the bank, but rather because... I'm not allowed to be guilty. Because Blacksteel operators cannot be guilty. Because members of the Brynley family cannot be guilty...'
The girl holds up a teapot in her hands and gives the tea leaves floating on the surface a blow, but accidentally cuts her lip on the container's broken rim.
'...You want to know if I plan to stay out here forever?
'Umm... I think I do. Because here, every choice I make belongs not to Jessica of Blacksteel, or to Jessica of the Brynley family.'
Wiping the streaks of blood from the corner of her lips with her fingers, the girl smiles shyly at you.
'They belong to me alone.'

skins.description:
Jessica's combat outfit when she's out on missions. 
There's always a new hidden pocket to find somewhere unexpected, a true test of the wearer's memory.

The pockets of her combat outfit are stuffed with all kinds of miscellaneous bits and bobs. An additional yet unnecessary burden to bear. 
 She shoulders heavy responsibilities, and thus leaves clear and distinct footprints.

<color name=#ffffff>Collaborative Series/'Ride to Davistown'. Clothes the rookie actress Jessica wore for her audition. Whether pointing a gun at someone else or at herself, she'd immediately tear up. Director Nian was real pleased.</color>

skills.desc:
ATK <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</>, increases DEF of self and Mobile Riot Shield by <@ba.vup>+{def:0%}</>, and increases duration of Mobile Riot Shield by <@ba.vup>+{duration}</> seconds
<@ba.rem>Unlimited duration</>
Attack Range <@ba.vup>expands</>, ATK <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</>, Attack Interval <@ba.vup>reduces significantly</>, and gains <@ba.vup>75%</> Physical and Arts dodge

Attack Range <@ba.vup>+1</>, Attack Interval <@ba.vdown>increases</>, ATK <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</>, DEF <@ba.vup>+{jesca2_s_3[def].def:0%}</>, Mobile Riot Shield gains <@ba.vup>+{jesca2_s_3_token[def].def:0%}</> DEF
When the Mobile Riot Shield is deployed, immediately fires a shell forward that explodes upon reaching a target or its max distance, dealing <@ba.vup>{attack@extrabomb.atk_scale:0%}</> ATK as Physical damage to all enemies in an area and <$ba.stun>stunning</> them for <@ba.vup>{attack@extrabomb.stun}</> seconds
<@ba.rem>Skill activation grants {attack@trigger_time} Ammo, and the skill ends when all Ammo is used (can be manually deactivated)</>

The Mobile Riot Shield can only be deployed in the four tiles adjacent to Jessica the Liberated, and when deployed, Jessica the Liberated immediately turns to face the shield and increases the DEF of herself and units behind her by 5%

modules.desc:
Operator Jessica the Liberated has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for frontline preservation and blockading the enemy.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Defender Operator during field operations to exercise Sentry Protector responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

Holding her grandpa's hand, she climbs her way up onto the luxurious bureau.
'Alright, Jess, now before we start drawing, remember, first we clean our hands. No cake crumbs, no cookie crumbs.'
'I did! What are we gonna draw, Grandpa?'
'Ooh... lookit here, I got a certificate, from when ol' Grandpa came back from the frontier. But they forgot to draw me a darn picture of the place. How about you help me fill that in, Jessica?'
'Uhh... I've never been to the frontier, though...'
'Your brother and your sisters went a whole bunch with your dad, didn't they? They ever tell you what was out there?'
'They said the frontier's got nothing, but also said it's all... 'ripe for the picking.' I heard that, Grandpa, 'ripe for the picking,' but how do I draw it? I'm kind of lost...'
'Aw, heck, they love to teach you some strange old words. Say, forget that, how about you draw something the likes of which they've never seen. I'll teach you. Remember how I told you of the Seven Bastards of the wastes, those catapulting Liberi robbers?'
'Oh, yeah, yeah!'
'Remember what that big ol' cactus was shaped like?'
'Huge in every direction, like a mangler!'
'Remember why tumbleweeds make a good wild bonfire?'
'They're brambly and thin and they catch with a spark!'
'Remember how to ride a burdenbeast?'
'Pull the reins tight and straddle that saddle!'
'Attagirl, Jessica. You always wanted to know more, see more, just like your brother and sisters? You ask me, I bet my bottom dollar you'll be just like them once you're as grown up as them, oh the things you'll know and see. But Grandpa's personal little tales, I've not yet told a soul but you, Jessica. They don't know 'em—heck, your dad doesn't know 'em.'
'Okay! When they come back, I'll tell them, then I'll show them my picture, and it's gonna blow their socks off! 'Wow, Jessica, you heard stories we never got to hear!''
......
She pulls the burdenbeast's reins, straddles the saddle, and unfolds an old sheet of paper in the light of the sinking sun.
Just about below the edge of the wastes, its last warm rays shine through the paper. A sheen, she might swear, casts over faded fountain ink.
The old man trots his burdenback alongside her. She yanks the reins tight, and settles back in her seat.
'What's that you're peeking at, Jessica?'
'It's... a picture, something I drew when I was real young, of the frontier.'
'You came out here as a kid? Never mentioned that.'
'No, I just had someone describe it to me. Held my hand while I was drawing.'
'Not half bad, all things considered. Hell of a 'canvas' too.'
'This is his certificate, the one who showed me how to draw it. He was my grandfather.'
'Your grandfather. A hero of the states?'
'Yeah... a hero of the states. And a hero of mine.'

voice_lines.voiceText: While you were out, I tried to sort the documents on your desk for you... It shames me to admit it, but... I haven't made much progress when it comes to desk work.

I ran into Franka and Liskarm on my way to the dorms. Even though I hadn't seen them in so long, we talked like we were never apart... Um, Doctor, do you think, maybe, I c-could apply to serve on missions with them?

I don't have as much money on hand these days. I argued with my father a lot about pioneering in the barrenlands. And so... I stopped drawing from the family trust fund. But I can still earn some money out there pioneering, at least enough to maintain my equipment.

When I was little, everyone always had so much on their plates. Only my retired grandfather could stay at home with me. He would tell me stories about his time in the army, so that he can cheer me up this way. Even though his past never stopped tormenting him, he was still willing to fluff it into tidy little stories, just to make me smile.

There was a soirée a while ago where someone brought up the war in Victoria. I chimed in with my own experiences. Only a few words, but enough to ruin everyone's time. You know, Doctor, that was the moment I finally realized why Blacksteel mercenaries rarely talk about themselves.

I'm nominally still employed by Blacksteel, but it's been a while since I've done any mercenary work. No, it's not that I regret the decision I made back then; I'm just tired of responding to disaster, always one step behind. This time, I want to be there to protect something from the beginning.
Doctor... Would you mind coming to the training room with me? I don't need a spotter, it's just... new operators keep coming to me for advice, and facing them alone makes me feel a— a little nervous.

Oh... You want to know about the flower on my chest? Actually... it wasn't an accessory to begin with. It was a shard of metal that got lodged in my leg. After it was surgically removed, I... decided to turn it into a buttonhole flower instead of throwing it away. Y-Yeah, I guess it is kinda weird. I'm not sure what I was thinking.

I know now that there's no shame in crying... or having a soft heart. If you're sad about something you can't put into words, why not express your feelings with tears? It's part of being human, so there's nothing to be ashamed of.  Um... Am I right, Doctor?
You look a little worse for wear every time I see you... Are you doing alright these days, Doctor?

It's been a while since we last met, Doctor. I'm glad there's still something I can do for you. That's right, I have changed a lot. If you could find the time, I'd love to sit down with you and catch up...

I just dug up my old combat records, which proved to be pretty useful. Comparing my before-and-after, I at least know what mistakes I shouldn't be making again. Ugh, I really looked like a... bumbling idiot back then.
I'm just glad to receive your acknowledgement, Doctor. The rewards are secondary.
Doctor, are you giving me a promotion? Then, can I... make a teensy tiny extra request? It's nothing big, just... Can I... have a hug?
Come in, Commander, this is Jessica. On the line and ready to roll.
Rally on me.
ETA six mikes.
Hostiles sighted, over.
In position.
Roger, wilco.
I'm headed into the thick of it.
With all of you behind me, I won't take a single step back.
Drawing a bead on the target.
Don't come any closer…
Requesting permission to fire.
Be adviced. Target… eliminated.
No resting on your laurels now... We've got more fighting ahead of us.
That was close, I almost... A-Anyway, good thing I managed to pull through in the end... Sorry, Doctor. Please, give me a minute. I need to get my emotions under control.
I think... a minor setback is no big deal. It's already enough that none of our people got hurt.
Doctor, an apology doesn't even begin to cut it... I'll try to make up for this failure on subsequent operations.
How I miss the time I spent on this landship... If only I could've stayed longer...
Go ahead, Doctor.
You looked a little surprised shaking my hand just now... D-Did my calluses scare you, Doctor?
Arknights.

Doctor, getting to sit here with you exchanging New Year's wishes is already pretty nice. I remember that time in Bolívar, the only thing I had to share the New Year with was a gun thiiiiiiiis big. Yeah, bigger than me.
Glad to see you again, Doctor.

Happy birthday, Doctor. I brought you a gift from the frontier... A jar of all-natural maple syrup. Though it's not as fancy as the stuff I used to get you, it's a rare treat where I live. It's can't even buy it with money; you have to head out to the forest to collect it yourself.

I used to be so preoccupied with what goals and achievements I would score in the future. But my experiences in recent years have shattered those fantasies. Just getting to grant some happiness and dignity to the people in your life is already good enough.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to a Trading Post, order acquisition efficiency <@cc.vup>+10%</> and the order limit <@cc.vup>+4</>

When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, self Morale loss per hour <@cc.vdown>+0.5</>; for each <$cc.g.bs><@cc.kw>Blacksteel Worldwide</></> Operator assigned to Factories, productivity <@cc.vup>+5%</>
